source.ab48b73e:
import h2o
from h2o.automl import H2OAutoML

h2o.init(max_mem_size='15G')
source.03ba147b:
x = ['C'+str(i) for i in range(512)]
y = 'identity_hate'
source.780cb6ed:
# For binary classification, response should be a factor
train[y] = train[y].asfactor()
source.f367c5bc:
# Run AutoML for 20 base models (limited to 1 hour max runtime by default)
aml = H2OAutoML(max_models=120, seed=1, max_runtime_secs=29000)
aml.train(x=x, y=y, training_frame=train)
source.03960fec:

lb = aml.leaderboard
lb.head(rows=lb.nrows)  # Print all rows instead of default (10 rows)

source.94ccb472: [H2O AutoML](http://docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-docs/automl.html) is an automated machine learning meta-algorithm that is part of the [H2O software library](http://docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-py/docs/intro.html#what-is-h2o). (It shold not be confused with [H2O DriverlessAI](https://www.h2o.ai/products/h2o-driverless-ai/), which is a commercial product and built from an entirely different code base.) H2O’s AutoML can be used for automating the machine learning workflow, which includes automatic training and tuning of many models within a user-specified time-limit. Stacked Ensembles – one based on all previously trained models, another one on the best model of each family – will be automatically trained on collections of individual models to produce highly predictive ensemble models which, in most cases, will be the top performing models in the AutoML Leaderboard.
